trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Projectplace | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Projectplace | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Projectplace with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Projectplace with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Projectplace.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Projectplace.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Projectplace single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A Projectplace single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Projectplace will be able to single sign into the application at your Projectplace company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Projectplace will be able to single sign into the application at your Projectplace company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Projectplace
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Projectplace

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Projectplace.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Projectplace.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Projectplace.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Projectplace.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Projectplace, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Projectplace, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>ProjectPlace</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>ProjectPlace</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Projectplace with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Projectplace with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Projectplace application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Projectplace application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Projectplace page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Projectplace page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Projectplace Sign On URL textbox, type your ProjectPlace tenant URL (e.g.: "http://company.projectplace.com"), and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Projectplace Sign On URL textbox, type your ProjectPlace tenant URL (e.g.: "http://company.projectplace.com"), and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Projectplace page, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Projectplace page, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Send the metadatafile to the Projectplace support team.
trans-unit.target: Send the metadatafile to the Projectplace support team.

trans-unit.source: The single sign-on configuration has to be performed by the Projectplace support team.
trans-unit.target: The single sign-on configuration has to be performed by the Projectplace support team.

trans-unit.source: You will get a notification as soon as the configuration has been completed.
trans-unit.target: You will get a notification as soon as the configuration has been completed.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Projectplace, they must be provisioned into Projectplace.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Projectplace, they must be provisioned into Projectplace.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Projectplace, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Projectplace, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Projectplace company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Projectplace company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to People, and then click Members.
trans-unit.target: Go to People, and then click Members.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>People</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>People</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add Member.
trans-unit.target: Click Add Member.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add Members</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add Members</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Add Member section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Add Member section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New Members</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New Members</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the New Members textbox, type the email address of a valid AAD account you want to provision into the related textboxes.
trans-unit.target: In the New Members textbox, type the email address of a valid AAD account you want to provision into the related textboxes.

trans-unit.source: Click Send
trans-unit.target: Click Send

trans-unit.source: An email including a link to confirm the account before it becomes active is sent to the Azure Active Directory account holder.
trans-unit.target: An email including a link to confirm the account before it becomes active is sent to the Azure Active Directory account holder.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Projectplace user account creation tools or APIs provided by Projectplace to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Projectplace user account creation tools or APIs provided by Projectplace to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Projectplace **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Projectplace **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
